duck: Option-adjusted spread, on mortgage backed securities where the borrower has the right to repay in full
Two-page spread a redundant term, also simply called "spread", referring to two adjacent, facing pages in a magazine or other publication with conjoined or connected content
spread definition: to open or expand over a larger area.
Yield spread, difference in percentage rate of return of two instruments
Spread (food), an edible paste put on other foods
Spread trade, between two related securities or commodities
Spread spectrum, communications signals over a range of frequencies
Bid-offer spread, between the buying and selling price of a commodity or security
Statistical dispersion - In statistics, dispersion denotes how stretched or squeezed is a distribution.

Protests spread in Afghanistan

Cholera spreads to Port-au-Prince, five cases reported
Unrest spreads to Morocco; police violently break up demonstrations

French transportation strike spreads to civil servants
WHO says spread of Bird Flu among humans limited
Hackers try to use German Wikipedia to spread links to malicious code
Bacterial meningitis possibly spread on AirTran flight

wiki.text:
'Spread' may refer to: *Statistical dispersion *Spread (food), an edible paste
put on other foods *the score difference being wagered on in spread betting *the
measure of line inclination in rational trigonometry *Temperature-Dewpoint
spread, dew point depression *Two-page spread a redundant term, also simply
called "spread", referring to two adjacent, facing pages in a magazine or other
publication with conjoined or connected content *In finance, the difference in
price between related securities, **Bid-offer spread, between the buying and
selling price of a commodity or security **Spread trade, between two related
securities or commodities **Option-adjusted spread, on mortgage backed
securities where the borrower has the right to repay in full **Yield spread,
difference in percentage rate of return of two instruments **Yield curve spread,
on mortgage backed securities **Credit spread (bond), on bonds
* a term used for speed reading in policy debate. *The laying of Tarot cards for
  divinatory uses.
* A word used sexually to describe the displaying of a female's vagina and anus
  when she is bent over. *''Spread'' (film), a 2009 film *Spread, West Virginia
